intro: Ruellia ciliosa, commonly known as the hairy ruellia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces, giving it its common name. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, with five petals and a distinctive tubular corolla. Ruellia ciliosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
